qas.question: What was the earliest confirmed evidence of the Chinese script?
Where were the symbols carved on?

answers.text: pieces of bone and turtle shell

qas.question: Where was the source of Oracle bones traced to?

answers.text: village near Anyang in Henan Province

context: The earliest confirmed evidence of the Chinese script yet discovered is the body of inscriptions on <a0_0>oracle bones<a0_0/> from the late Shang dynasty (c. 1200–1050 BC). These symbols, carved on <a1_0>pieces of bone and turtle shell<a1_0/> being sold as "dragon bones" for medicinal purposes, were identified as Chinese writing by scholars in 1899. By 1928, the source of the oracle bones had been traced to a <a2_0>village near Anyang in Henan Province<a2_0/>, which was excavated by the Academia Sinica between 1928 and 1937. Over 150,000 fragments have been found.
